alert.note: Alert for Lower Columbia (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 13 at 4:57AM PDT until June 14 at 6:00AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Washington... Columbia River at Longview affecting I-5 Corridor in Cowlitz County and Lower Columbia zones. Columbia River at Vancouver affecting Greater Portland Metro Area and Greater Vancouver Area zones. .Periods of heavy rain over the past 48 hours combined with melting snowpack in the mountains has resulted in rising river levels along the Columbia River. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Columbia River at Longview. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Above 13.5 feet, expect minor flooding of farmland and low-lying areas not protected by levees along the Columbia. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:18 AM PDT Monday the stage was 12.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is forecast to approach minor flood stage of 13.5 feet early Monday and early Tuesday. - Flood stage is 13.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
